reviews.review: Its a good game to play with friends.

Its really fun. But the community is super toxic. If you run literally any meta perk then you're considered the scum of the earth. Also the queue times are really long for killer. I find it most fun when played as custom games with 4 other friends, because you can use any perk without unlocking it, and it's far less toxic.

Dead by Daylight, ein tolles und groÃŸartiges Spiel. Total.

Nach 50 Stunden impulsiven, wirklich unvergleichlichen Gameplay sind meine Katze und ich zur folgenden Ergebnissen gekommen.

Vornweg, dieses Spiel sollte man wirklich nur mit seinen Freunden spielen um einen Herzinfarkt zu vermeiden.

Nun was erwartet einem, wenn man dieses Spiel mit Random Spielern spielt?

Ganz viel von diesen Dingen:

Hacker und Cheater,

ja auch in diesem Spiel gibt es sie, die Menschen die cheaten mÃ¼ssen weil ihr Urinauswerfer vermutlich einfach nicht messbar ist, fast wie mein Puls wenn ich an meine Ex denke

Camper und Tunnler:

wieder mal ein Killer der das Spiel mit einem Campingplatz verwechselt und schneller Wurzeln schlÃ¤gt als der LÃ¶wenzahn auf dem Beton

Antiteammates und Troller:

neben Combat Logger gibt es auch Ãœberlebende die absolut keinen Bock auf Team haben oder dich am Haken vergammeln lassen, wie das letzte StÃ¼ck Pizza im KÃ¼hlschrank von letzter Woche

Und natÃ¼rlich gibtâ€™s auch hier richtig viele Mitspieler die ihren Frust dann gern auch mal im Chat auslassen und die hÃ¤rter beleidigen als der 10 JÃ¤hrige, vorhin im Bus â€“ bevorzugt wird das oft von Nutzer der kyrillischen Schrift genutzt.

Dieses Spiel ist keineswegs schlecht aber wird einfach kaputt gemacht, durch ein Teil der Communtiy die den Spielgenuss richtig versauen.
tiene mas bugs y golpes por lag de malos servidores que el demonio pero esta re chingon mis panas, 430h que si no fuera por esos lags serian ya 1000h

l'univers est biens que sa soit les personnages (tueur comme survivant) ou les cartes. Malheuresement le jeu n'est pas Ã©quilibrÃ© pour une aussi grande diffÃ©rence avec des joueur pro. Au lieu de donner au survivant des moyens de mieux fuir et se cacher, il leurs on donner la possibilitÃ© de rendre fou le tueur Ã  haut niveau (Ã©tourdir aveugler en boucle). Il on donc du buff les tueurs et les rendre de plus en plus puissant laissent les joueur Ã  bas niveau se faire rouler dessus. Avec des tueurs aussi fort il on donc du donner plus de moyens au survivant. La boucle est boucler.
Behaviour Interactive Inc.  Please 1 More time buy Sales another  character !!!! I want to buy all!!!!

The idea of a 4v1 game has always intrigued me. When I heard that this was horror themed I was instantly sold on it. Who doesn't want to play a demonic looking, chainsaw-wielding maniac while nabbing teenagers out of closets and sticking them on meathooks as a sacrifice to a nameless Elder God? ...Just me?

Dead by Daylight is an asymetric horror survival game with a pretty simple goal: the team of four Survivors repair five generators followed by a gate to escape. The Killer tries to stop that from happening. The Killer can sabotage the generators, attack the Survivors, and hang them on meathooks as a sacrifice to an Elder God called simply "The Entity".

There is a HUGE assortment of characters in this game, a good handful of which are from popular shows/movies/games. (Note: As of this review there are 22 Survivors and 20 Killers.) Each character comes with unique perks to help them gain an edge in-game. The Killers all have unique attacks and abilities as well. On top of perks, there are also items like the Medkit and the Flashlight, as well as add-ons for those items to help further diversify your gameplay. These are all attainable via the Bloodweb, a procedually-generated progression tree that you spend Blood Points, the game's main currency, to fill out. There are also these items called Offerings, which you discard at the beginning of every match to alter how the match will take place. 

There is a high level of stealth and teamwork involved on the Survivor side. For the Killer, a high degree of patience and relentlessness.

There are downsides however. The community and the "meta" have put a bad taste in my mouth. With the way things are right now, the main objective of every game is not to escape but to farm Blood Points. It's become less about finishing the match and more about timing obstacles correctly to maximize your BP gain. This "esportsification" of the game has taken the edge off of gameplay. It's turned the game into an arcadey versus game where everybody wins instead of what it was supposed to be at its core: a survival horror. There are no stakes; only the theorycrafting and currency farming that has plagued multiplayer games for years. The horror aspect of the game is only a thin veneer as a result.

As for the community, it could definitely be placed among the top 5 most toxic playerbases, on par with League of Legends and Call of Duty. Everybody wins and nobody's happy about it. It's truly bizarre to behold. I've been told I should uninstall the game, commit suicide, throw my computer into the trash, throw myself into the trash. I've been called about every name in the book - some creative, some not. 

Yet despite this game's shortcomings I still enjoy it. The gameplay loop is satisfying to me. It's an easy way to kill 15 minutes or spend all night playing, which is what I just finished doing right before I wrote this review.

I will highly recommend playing this with friends. It's a great time if you're just playing to laugh. The Kill Your Friends mode has been some of the best times I've had playing this game. No BP to grind. Just you and some friends playing a wild game of hide and seek.

This game is absolutely worth the asking price. Plus it goes on sale quite often so the many DLC packs available are easily attainable. 

Now if you'll excuse me, there are some teenagers that need hooked.

/ËˆmasÉ™ËŒkizÉ™m,ËˆmazÉ™ËŒkizÉ™m/
Learn to pronounce
noun
the tendency to derive pleasure, especially sexual gratification, from one's own pain or humiliation.
"with things such as bondage and masochism, it's all right if you both go for it"
(in general use) the enjoyment of what appears to be painful or tiresome.
"isn't there some masochism involved in taking on this kind of project?"

It's a fun and exciting game!

Playing with friends is especially fun in a custom game as a killer. I love to hear their screams of fear and despair on Discord as I hunt them down. >:D

Referente ao principal ponto fraco para nÃ³s brasileiros Ã© o nÃºmero baixo de players, para jogar de killer Ã© necessÃ¡rio paciÃªncia caso nÃ£o seja horÃ¡rio de pico, de survivor Ã© bem tranquilo em qualquer horÃ¡rio, mas ainda assim vai cair em muitos jogos com ranks discrepantes entre os players e muitos hermanos.
Sobre as DLC's, importante notar que elas entram frequentemente em promoÃ§Ã£o, com Ã³timos descontos e tambÃ©m o conteÃºdo delas pode ser adquirido ingame (todas, exceto DLC's de conteÃºdos de outros jogos e filmes, como Stranger Things, por exemplo).
Se vocÃª Ã© uma pessoa que joga sozinho, esse jogo jÃ¡ te proporciona uma experiÃªncia bem bacana, mas recomendo ver uns vÃ­deos para conhecer primeiro, se pretende jogar com amigos, Ã© extremamente divertido, um extra ainda se tiver +4 amigos com o jogo, pois poderÃ¡ jogar "Kill your friends" ou "Custom Game" que Ã© MUITO divertido.
PrÃ³s:
- DLC's entram em promoÃ§Ã£o frequentemente
- ConteÃºdo de mais da metade das DLC's pode ser obtido ingame
- Bem feito, poucos bugs, sÃ³ comeÃ§a a se notar bugs com muitas horas de jogo pq sÃ£o detalhes
- Divertido e nÃ£o Ã© enjoativo
- Ã‰ possÃ­vel jogar sem DLC's de forma balanceada, mas a longo prazo as DLC's vÃ£o ser necessÃ¡rias

Contras:
- Muitas DLC's
- A longo prazo comeÃ§a a perceber muitos bugs, que atÃ© sÃ£o considerados "features"

- O verdadeiro gameplay e noÃ§Ã£o de jogo nÃ£o Ã© intuitivo, Ã© necessÃ¡rio muitas horas para desvendar sozinho ou ajuda de vÃ­deos/amigos

--> Se vocÃª vai comprar, aqui algumas dicas minhas:
- Assista alguns vÃ­deos no youtube de gameplay para ter algumas noÃ§Ãµes.
- Independente se o seu favorito Ã© sobrevivente ou assasino, jogue um pouco com o outro lado sempre, isso ajuda muito a adivinhar o que o adversÃ¡rio estÃ¡ pensando e fazendo
- Muda a aÃ§Ã£o de struggle ou resistir no gancho de barra de espaÃ§o para a rodinha do mouse (para baixo de peferencia)
- Esse jogo envolve tÃ©cnica mÃªcanica (teclado e mouse), mas o principal Ã© o mindgame ou jogo mental, sempre se coloque na posiÃ§Ã£o do adversÃ¡rio e pense o que ele faria no seu caso, pois assim vocÃª antecipa as aÃ§Ãµes inimigas e consegue ganhar, cada segundo conta nesse jogo.
- Se for jogar de assassino, Ã© normal os sobreviventes chorarem no lobby pÃ³s partida, mesmo q tudo esteja certo, alguÃ©m vai chorar, nÃ£o deixe os outros de julgarem, vocÃª sabe se estava fazendo merda ou nÃ£o, para os sobreviventes vale o mesmo, porÃ©m os killers reclamam muito menos do q os sobreviventes.
It's definitely had it's ups and downs but I'm enjoying it right now. I'm just a casual though. There are toxic players on occasion but what game doesn't have that.

Honestly, not a bad game. It's fun, it's thrilling but it caters everything towards the killer. I'm all for using your wits to outsmart the killer but even then, once you're in the killers sights, it's over. You can basically do nothing as a survivor so honestly if the devs were to give the survivors more then this game would be perfect.

me gusta las tetas de la rubia

This game has a lot going for it. Relatively quick matches, fairly easy to pick up (on the survivor side) and an interesting concept to name a few. However, there are some major things that are going to drive me away. The matchmaking is horrible. If you main a killer after the first 25 hours prepare to get matched with survivors MANY levels above you in skill and time. The survive with friends groups using a third party voice chat also are a pain. The game mechanics are not built for survivors to have voice capability. The community is also toxic as hell. Want to have people curse and bitch at you for playing a game? Look no further.

**update** So, turns out I must be a masochist. The matchmaking is still trash, but I keep playing. The toxic community is still ever present. My SO also observed me gaming, and she says I shouldn't play with how angry this game makes me. But for some reason I keep coming back. So for that reason I recommend it.
This game sucks, I love it.

Game's good once you get through the rough patch of not having any perks. Half the community is extremely toxic. I'd recommend not to get the game unless you're willing to weather the storm of toxicity.
